alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 22 at 12:04PM EDT until July 22 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Dale County in southeastern Alabama... Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Calhoun County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 100 PM EDT/noon CDT/. * At 1204 PM EDT/1104 AM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Richards Crossroads to near Ozark, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Fort Novosel, Ozark, Headland, Edison, Ariton, Newville, Bellville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Shorterville, Hooper Stage Field, Parksville, Carnegie, Hayes, Scottsboro Crossroads, Pecan, Ewell and Dale County Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
